meanings.sent1: The cafeteria served the nastiest food I have ever tasted.
meanings.sent2: That was the nastiest prank anyone has ever played on me.
meanings.sent3: The dog made the nastiest face when it smelled the old fish.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought the nastiest winds we had ever experienced.
meanings.sent5: The garbage left in the sun had the nastiest smell imaginable.

meanings.sent1: She gave me the nastiest look when I won the game.
meanings.sent2: His nastiest comments always come out when he is angry.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave the nastiest glare to the dog stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The politician's nastiest attack was during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The villain's nastiest plan was to destroy the hero's reputation.

meanings.sent1: The bathroom was the nastiest room in the house.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the kids were the nastiest they had ever been.
meanings.sent3: The mud made the dog's fur look the nastiest it had ever been.
meanings.sent4: The river was the nastiest it had been in years after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen sink was the nastiest part of the whole house to clean.
